page.title: 18All Hallows, Dean
page.content: All Hallows Church is a splendid survival from Mediaeval times. Among the early features are the chancel arch and the North door, dating from before 1300, and a canopy tomb in the north aisle with rare Lombardic lettering. The tower was built in 14th century and bristles with gargoyles and weird heads. The main rebuilding was in 15th century when the beautiful roof was installed. One of the best angel roofs in the country, this shows the Mediaeval craftsman at his most competent. An angel motif is used on the recently embroidered hassocks which record much of the village's local history.
